snippet: Experts hope that the search is over for the Griffin, a ship lost in Lake Michigan over 300 years ago that was commanded by a 17th-century French explorer.
abstract: Experts hope that search is over for the Griffin, 40-foot ship lost in Lake Michigan over 300 years ago that was commanded by 17th-century French explorer Rene-Robert Cavelier, Sieur de La Salle, in his quest to find mouth of Mississippi River; team of experts believe they can uncover shipwreck after settlement of bitter legal battle finally gives way to excavation permit.
lead_paragraph: Experts hope that the search is over for the Griffin, a ship lost in Lake Michigan over 300 years ago that was commanded by a 17th-century French explorer.

headline.main: Clues in the Search for a Sunken Ship, Lost in the 1600s
headline.print_headline: Clues in the Search For a Sunken Ship, Lost in the 1600s
